channel.name: BBC Two NL
channel.title: Empire with David Olusoga
channel.desc: At its height the British Empire - the biggest the world has ever seen - ruled over a fifth of the world's land surface and almost a quarter of its people. Scattered across the world are the ruins of the Empire, from slave fortresses and plantations to schools and railways. But perhaps the greatest legacy of the Empire is a living legacy. Today, there are billions of people around the world whose ancestors were part of the story of Empire.
